item.title: Remembering Nob Hill Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Strip Gem
item.description:
A Budget-Friendly Oasis on the Strip

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always dominated by sprawling themed resorts and $100 blackjack. In the late 1970s, a different kind of casino thrived â€“ smaller, more accessible, and catering to a budget-conscious crowd. One such establishment was the Nob Hill Casino, a surprisingly short-lived, but fondly remembered, fixture at 3411 Las Vegas Boulevard South. Opened in the summer of 1978, Nob Hill carved out a unique niche, nestled between the legendary Sands and the Holiday Casino.
